title: Gerson Jackson
text:
Gerson Jackson is a <a href="Federated%20States%20of%20Micronesia">Micronesia</a>n <a href="politician">politician</a> and <a href="diplomat">diplomat</a>.
Jackson served as the <a href="Lieutenant%20Governor">Lieutenant Governor</a> of <a href="Kosrae">Kosrae</a> for two-consecutive terms from 1995 to 2007. He was first elected Lieutenant Governor in 1994 as the <a href="running%20mate">running mate</a> of <a href="Moses%20Mackwelung">Moses Mackwelung</a>. Mackwelung and Jackson were sworn into office on January 9, 1995. Jackson was re-elected as Lieutenant Governor in 1998 as the running mate of gubernatorial candidate, <a href="Rensley%20Sigrah">Rensley Sigrah</a>. Sigrah and Jackson were inaugurated on January 12, 1999.
Gerson Jackson served as <a href="Consul-General">Consul-General</a> of the <a href="Federated%20States%20of%20Micronesia">Federated States of Micronesia</a> to <a href="Guam">Guam</a> from 2008 to October 17, 2011. He was confirmed to the office in April 2008, in a unanimous 12-0 vote by the Micronesian Congress. During his tenure, Jackson criticized increased tensions toward Micronesian migrants in Guam, especially on issues of crime and <a href="deportation">deportation</a>. Jackson served as Consul-General until October 17, 2011, when his successor, <a href="Robert%20Ruecho">Robert Ruecho</a>, was sworn into office by <a href="President%20of%20the%20Federated%20States%20of%20Micronesia">President</a> <a href="Manny%20Mori">Manny Mori</a>.
Jackson became the <a href="Ambassador">Ambassador</a> of the Federated States of Micronesia to <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a> on October 17, 2011. President Manny Mori administered the <a href="oath%20of%20office">oath of office</a> to Jackson at the International Trade Center in Guam at 11:30 a.m.
